page.title: 05MONTFORD BRIDGE - AMENITIES
page.content:
The village's amenities have changed markedly over recent years.
The village no longer has a school, a resident policeman, a working garage (it is now just a petrol station combined with a shop and off-licence) or sporting facilities. Its Priest is now shared between three parishes.
The village does, however, possess a good shop and Post-Office. It has an Inn, the Wingfield Arms, which runs various functions such as Country and Western evenings and also serves meals and snacks. It has a village hall (see p.3) and a mobile library which visits fortnightly. There is also a village blacksmith and a carpenter.
